cont.entity_a: The stainless bowl had a small dent and fingerprints, indicating it may be reconditioned. Had to clean the bowl for 45 minutes due to contamination from the polishing process. The bowl developed rust spots. The stainless steel bowl and parts bleed a gray-blue substance into the dough. The bowl oozes black residue even after cleaning. The stainless bowl leaves a black residue on food.
cont.entity_b: The bowl is difficult to remove from the stand.

cont.entity_a: Received two units with defects: a gauge in the head and an unstable head. Received mixers with scratches, stains, and missing components. The mixer arrived with scratches and stains, suggesting poor quality control. Received a mixer with a bent knob that doesn't function properly.
Instructions for troubleshooting the unstable head were not applicable to the model.
The whip accessory turned into black powder after washing.
There was a crack in the metal causing the head to jump up and down during use.
The machine sparked and blew a fuse, indicating a safety hazard.
The stainless steel bowl and parts bleed a gray-blue substance into the dough. The bowl oozes black residue even after cleaning. The stainless bowl leaves a black residue on food.
cont.entity_b: The metal hub on the wire mixer deteriorates, leaving black powder.

cont.entity_a: The white ceramic dough hook coating chips after 4-5 uses. The coating on the dough hook chipped after a few uses. The dough hook was missing upon delivery.

Motor.comm: The motor started smoking after a few uses.

cont.entity_a: The motor is not as quiet as older models. The motor is louder and less durable compared to older models. The mixer does not turn on consistently and makes a terrible noise.
cont.entity_b: The motor burned out after two uses for cookie dough. The mixer has a powerful and quiet motor. The mixer is quieter than other models.

cont.entity_a: The mixer paddle slips and shakes due to the absence of a spring in the tool lock mechanism.
cont.entity_b: The flat beater mixes as well as KitchenAid mixers.

cont.entity_a: The head does not tilt on some models, making it inconvenient to remove beaters. The mixer head is wobbly and requires frequent adjustments.
cont.entity_b: The mixer wobbles at higher speeds.

cont.entity_a: The pouring shield does not fit the bowl completely.
cont.entity_b: The pouring shield is useful for adding flour. The splash guard moves and doesn't stay in place.

cont.entity_a: The mixer leaves ingredients at the bottom of the bowl unincorporated. The mixer is not suitable for heavy doughs, only light mixing tasks.
cont.entity_b: The mixer doesn't mix the very bottom of the bowl. The mixer performs well for general baking needs. The mixer struggles with bread dough and heavier tasks. The mixer is not suitable for heavy-duty tasks. The mixer requires manual scraping of bowl sides.

Durability.comm: The mixer is not as durable as older models.

cont.entity_a: The mixer has a loud motor and is difficult to adjust.
cont.entity_b: The mixer performs well but lacks durability.

Service.comm: Customer service is difficult to reach.

cont.entity_a: Customer service was difficult to reach for warranty claims.
The mixer lacks a spring to hold the paddle in place.
cont.entity_b: The mixer is sturdy but has a heavy motor. The mixer is heavy and requires a dedicated spot.
The mixer is easy to use and clean. The mixer is difficult to operate with one hand.
The mixer lacks capacity for food attachments.
The mixer has a three-year warranty.
The mixer has a stiff control lever.
